page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = KEY_EXIST(C tagname,A keyvalue)

argument.name: tagname
argument.description: The name of an index tag that may contain the Key_Value. The Index_Tag parameter can include a full drive and path specification. If you omit the drive and path, Alpha Anywhere searches the current directory.

argument.name: keyvalue
argument.description: A string constant, character variable, or an expression that returns a character value.

page.description: Returns TRUE if a specified key value is found in a specified index.
page.discussion: KEY_EXIST() returns .T. (TRUE) if Key_Value is found in index Index_Tag ; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). This function is useful for checking if a record with a certain key value already exists in the primary table. Note : If you want to define a Validation Field Rule to prevent the entry of a duplicate record, use KEY_UNIQUE(), not KEY_EXIST().
